page.title: 17EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS
page.content: {Coombe Girls' School}is situated in Clarence Avenue, New Malden and has nearly 1000 pupils aged between 11 and 18. It is a secondary modern school built in 1956. {The Ursuline Convent School}is a girls' Roman Catholic School in Crescent Road, S.W.20. It was founded in 1892 when it had 2 pupils. It now has nearly 1000 pupils between the ages of 13 and 18. {Wimbledon College}in Edge Hill S.W.19 was an army training college between 1860 and 1892. Then a Jesuit became head and it has been a boys' Roman Catholic School for 960 pupils between the ages of l3 and l8. {Holy Cross Convent Girls' School}in Sandal Road, New Malden was founded in a Victorian house in l93l with 5 pupils. New buildings were added in l937, l958 and l974. It now has 600
